title: What is the role of ROC Filing?
desc: ROC Filing oversees the administration of companies registered under the Companies Act, 2013.

title: How do I register my company with ROC Filing?
desc: File an application through the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) portal with necessary documents.

title: What are ROC Filing annual compliance requirements?
desc: Filing of financial statements, annual returns, and other statutory forms.

title: What is the penalty for non-filing of ROC Filing returns?
desc: Penalties include fines, additional fees, and potential disqualification of directors.

title: Can I change my company name with ROC Filing?
desc: Yes, a special resolution and ROC Filing approval are required to change the company name.

title: How do I file ROC Filing returns online?
desc: Returns can be filed on the MCA portal using your company's credentials.

title: What is the due date for ROC filings?
desc: Typically, annual filings are due within 30 days of the AGM or 180 days from the end of the financial year.

title: What is DIN, and why is it important?
desc: Director Identification Number (DIN) is mandatory for anyone serving as a director in a company.

title: Can I update my company address with ROC Filing?
desc: Yes, by filing Form INC-22 and obtaining ROC Filing approval.

title: What is the process for closing a company with ROC Filing?
desc: File the necessary forms and complete the strike-off process as per MCA guidelines.

title: How do I check my company's compliance status with ROC Filing?
desc: Compliance status can be checked on the MCA portal using the company CIN.

title: What is ROC Filing's role in mergers and acquisitions?
desc: ROC Filing ensures compliance during mergers, demergers, or acquisitions under the Companies Act.

title: Are LLPs required to file ROC Filing returns?
desc: Yes, LLPs must file annual returns and financial statements with ROC Filing.

title: How do I appoint or remove a director with ROC Filing?
desc: File relevant forms (DIR-12) on the MCA portal for appointment or removal.

title: What is XBRL filing in ROC Filing?
desc: XBRL (eXtensible Business Reporting Language) is a format for filing financial statements with ROC Filing for certain companies.
